displaytitle: Part of a military diploma issued during the joint reign of the emperors Septimius Severus and Caracalla (replacement base of vase)

titles.title: Part of a military diploma issued during the joint reign of the emperors Septimius Severus and Caracalla (replacement base of vase)

texts.textentryhtml: Purchased from Piero Tozzi, New York in 1955.

bibliography.boilertext: Brooks Levy, Rome and her enemies: the evidence of coinage: a supplement to the catalogue "Rome and the Germans" (nos. 1-176 of the exhibition), comprising materials added to the exhibit from the Princeton University collections, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Library, Department of Rare Books and Special Collections, 1988).
bibliography.citation: Brooks Levy, Rome and her enemies: the evidence of coinage: a supplement to the catalogue "Rome and the Germans" (nos. 1-176 of the exhibition), comprising materials added to the exhibit from the Princeton University collections, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Library, Department of Rare Books and Special Collections, 1988).

bibliography.boilertext: Frances F. Jones, "A bronze head-vase", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 46, no. 2 (1987): p. 16–19.
bibliography.citation: Frances F. Jones, "A bronze head-vase", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 46, no. 2 (1987): p. 16–19., p. 16ff; fig. 1-4

bibliography.boilertext: Joyce M. Reynolds, "A Roman military diploma at Princeton," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 46, no. 2 (1987): p. 24–27.
bibliography.citation: Joyce M. Reynolds, "A Roman military diploma at Princeton," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 46, no. 2 (1987): p. 24–27., pp. 24–6, figs. 1–2

bibliography.boilertext: "Recent acquisitions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 15, no. 1 (1956): p. 26-27.
